Posts.Content: singletona80 wrote: I have been coming to this thread reading what you ladies are going through and I havent posted becuz I have yet to run into someone who developed LE before surgery.  To make a long story short . . . .Before I was diagnosed with BC in June, one day my left arm and fingers swole up.  I thought I might have pulled a muscle.  Fast forward to being diagnosed with BC in late June ( I just finished neoadjuvant chemo (DD AC-T), surgery schduled for 11/23 BMX, radiation to follow sometime after that)  . . . my doc seems to think the tumor might be pressing on a lymph node.  Neways he referred me to a LE therapist and she taught me how to wrap my arm with bandages, I got the compress sleeve and glove, and I have the solaris Tribute night time garmet.  My LE therapist said she wont do the MLD until the cancer has been treated, so Im assuming after surgery, maybe radiation I will be going back to LE specialist.  I was just wondering if there was anyone like me ??  Im wondering is this a "younger women" BC issue?? TIA 33 yrs old ~~ 11/10/2011 Stage IV, mets to left lung -- Originally Dx @ age 29yr, (2010) Neoadjuvant Chemo DD AC-T , BMX, 25 sessions of RADS Dx 6/29/2010, IDC, 5cm, Stage IIIB, Grade 2, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2- Chemotherapy 7/26/2010 AC + T (Taxol) Surgery 11/22/2010 Mastectomy: Left; Prophylactic mastectomy: Right Radiation Therapy 12/16/2010 Breast Dx 11/2011, IDC, Stage IV, Grade 2, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2- Chemotherapy 11/12/2011 Taxotere (docetaxel), Xeloda (capecitabine) Hormonal Therapy 9/28/2012 Arimidex (anastrozole) Chemotherapy 12/19/2013 Xeloda (capecitabine) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: What about Lymphedema BEFORE Surgery ??? singletona80 singletona80

Posts.Content: singletona80 wrote: Can you still have breast reconstruction when you have been "upgraded"  to stage IV ( if thats what you want to call it) Originally I was supposed to be having delayed reconstruction sometime in the upcoming year, but now with this new development in regards to my health, im unsure .   Obvisiously my first concern is knocking this cancer out my body but I was just curious  TIA !!!!!!!!!! 33 yrs old ~~ 11/10/2011 Stage IV, mets to left lung -- Originally Dx @ age 29yr, (2010) Neoadjuvant Chemo DD AC-T , BMX, 25 sessions of RADS Dx 6/29/2010, IDC, 5cm, Stage IIIB, Grade 2, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2- Chemotherapy 7/26/2010 AC + T (Taxol) Surgery 11/22/2010 Mastectomy: Left; Prophylactic mastectomy: Right Radiation Therapy 12/16/2010 Breast Dx 11/2011, IDC, Stage IV, Grade 2, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2- Chemotherapy 11/12/2011 Taxotere (docetaxel), Xeloda (capecitabine) Hormonal Therapy 9/28/2012 Arimidex (anastrozole) Chemotherapy 12/19/2013 Xeloda (capecitabine) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: This just popped into my head . . . . singletona80 singletona80

Posts.Content: singletona80 wrote: Has anyone had any experience with Marzels in Walnut Creek or Pleasanton,  (for prostheses) selection and fitting ??? A few ladies have already shared their experience in regards to Nordstrom's Thanks. Are there any other places you experienced ?? Are there any places to "stay" away from. Posts.Title: Bay Area Folks . . . singletona80 mbordo

Posts.Content: singletona80 wrote: Since I only have a few months in as stage 4 I was wondering... Typically do you become stable before the cancer shrinks? Or can you have shrinkage & then become stable? or is there no rhyme or reason? 33 yrs old ~~ 11/10/2011 Stage IV, mets to left lung -- Originally Dx @ age 29yr, (2010) Neoadjuvant Chemo DD AC-T , BMX, 25 sessions of RADS Dx 6/29/2010, IDC, 5cm, Stage IIIB, Grade 2, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2- Chemotherapy 7/26/2010 AC + T (Taxol) Surgery 11/22/2010 Mastectomy: Left; Prophylactic mastectomy: Right Radiation Therapy 12/16/2010 Breast Dx 11/2011, IDC, Stage IV, Grade 2, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2- Chemotherapy 11/12/2011 Taxotere (docetaxel), Xeloda (capecitabine) Hormonal Therapy 9/28/2012 Arimidex (anastrozole) Chemotherapy 12/19/2013 Xeloda (capecitabine) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I was wondering about... Stable & Reggie? singletona80 Chickadee

Posts.Content: singletona80 wrote: I just had my last chemo tx today 11/2, surgery schduled for 11/23, still deciding on the removal of one breast or both (Im leaning towards having both removed), neways from reading on here and asking my dr I know you dont get fitted for a prostheses until after the swelling has gone down, which could take a few weeks etc.  But I was wondering how soon after you've been "fiited"  do you actually get the prothesis ?? Im thinking bout going through Nordstrom's, has anyone had experience with them ?? 33 yrs old ~~ 11/10/2011 Stage IV, mets to left lung -- Originally Dx @ age 29yr, (2010) Neoadjuvant Chemo DD AC-T , BMX, 25 sessions of RADS Dx 6/29/2010, IDC, 5cm, Stage IIIB, Grade 2, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2- Chemotherapy 7/26/2010 AC + T (Taxol) Surgery 11/22/2010 Mastectomy: Left; Prophylactic mastectomy: Right Radiation Therapy 12/16/2010 Breast Dx 11/2011, IDC, Stage IV, Grade 2, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2- Chemotherapy 11/12/2011 Taxotere (docetaxel), Xeloda (capecitabine) Hormonal Therapy 9/28/2012 Arimidex (anastrozole) Chemotherapy 12/19/2013 Xeloda (capecitabine) Log in to post a reply
